answers.answer: Hi, I think your symptom may be related to obesity or sleep apnea. Diastolic dysfunction is commonly accompanied with one or both of them. I recommend you to receive examination in one-by-one manner and to start diet modification.Thank you

question: Hi I am a 44 year old female I do not have diabetes or hypertension.  I am over weight 230lbs at 5'4".  I recenty went to see a cardiologist for what i was percieving as skipped heart beats and some shortness of breath after walking up stairs.  He ordered a stress echo and holter monitor.  the findings were diastolic dysfunction grade 1, a ""small localized" pericardial effusion. the holter moniter showed some PVC's.  He then ordered an event monitor which i wore for 30 days .  I am going to get the results tomorrow.  My question is what further testing would you think I might need and what kind of questions would you ask?  I am scared there is some underlying heart disease or something.  could any of this cause my shortness of breath?  I have been abnormally fatogued lately.  Why would i have a pericardial effusion?  My dr acted like it was not anything to worry about  but of course after researching it on the internet it concerns me.  thanks so much.
title: Diastolic Dysfunction, PVC's Pericardial effusion
